title: Art and Reality: Warwick Student Documentaries
short_description: Five documentaries made by Warwick student in total. They cover different themes, including the use of AI in art, marine life, student activism and a football team at Warwick. They are all the entries to the Warwick Documentary Society, but we would like to ensure that credits are given to all student filmmakers. We hope that the screening can encourage students to create their own documentaries and appreciate creative talents around them.

schedule_organisation.name: Warwick Documentary Society
schedule_organisation.description:
Warwick Documentary Society is where you can watch, discuss, and make documentaries!

We watch a wide spectrum of documentaries, from 5-minute experimental to Oscar-winning blockbusters, from politics and animals to cults. No experience or knowledge related to documentary production is required, just come and watch wonderful productions of all times and all places!

title: Last Orders
short_description:
Last Orders is a student written show that was first put on at University of Warwick via Freshblood New Writing Society. Since the success of the first sold out run, we have made a few tweaks and refinements to take this magnificent show to Edinburgh Fringe! A brilliant opportunity for all involved with some first time Fringe goers.

Our show follows Kenneth's first day working at the McGonagall Tavern, though as we are introduced to witches, a couple rats, the uptight manager, the creative yet unstable chef and the critic. Well, we are in for a ride.

short_description: We’ll be playing a variety of folk tunes for you to dance to!

schedule_organisation.name: Warwick Folk
schedule_organisation.description: Warwick Folk Society is a very relaxed music group for musicians of any age ability, or instrument. We play different styles of folk from across the world, usually from the British Isles and run various dances, ceilidhs and gigs throughout the year. Our style of playing tends to focus more on the enthusiasm than keeping to the dots. The sheet music acts as a guide to what we play.

schedule_organisation.name: BrassSoc
schedule_organisation.description: The University of Warwick Brass Society or BrassSoc for short is a fun, friendly and lively group to get involved with. The society welcomes all brass players, percussionists and even those who have never picked up a brass instrument before! Our award winning ensembles (which include a brass band, a symphonic brass ensemble and a beginners brass group) welcome all standards of musicians, and (apart from symphonic brass) are all non-auditioned. With over 50 members, we provide opportunities for all brass players to rehearse, perform and socialise regularly.

title: Healing in Real Time
short_description: Spoken word - healing in real time
long_description: Sharing a few spoken word peaces touching on emotions from healing to hurt, and self discovery.

schedule_organisation.name: Adèle Beecham
schedule_organisation.description: Adèle is a multi-award winning Filmmaker, musician and spoken word artist. Writing since a young age, Spoken word and poetry are particularly special to her because they give her a space to express her emotions differently. she aims to share her heart in every poem and hopes that each piece brings a little healing and peace to all those who read them.

title: The Strongest Block Floor
short_description: An artistic masterpiece depicting our well loved flatmate Daiki, of whom has been residing with us for almost a year. He will only be with us for a few more weeks, but his effect on Warwick University life will be felt for generations to come. No man who has been graced by his presence will be left without a smile, and this artform exists to immortalise and encapsulate only a fraction of his glory.

title: An Evening of Modern Guitar
short_description: A performance of solo electric guitar, playing modern pieces by world-renowned guitar virtuoso Ichika Nito, as well as new composed pieces inspired by him being brought to the light.
long_description:
A unique performance of solo electric guitar and singing, featuring solo pieces by world renowned guitarist Ichika Nito, and originals inspired by both him and Laufey. 

Expect to see some of the pieces that helped make Ichika known world-wide such as Orb and Homesick, and a few extra songs you'll have to turn up to hear!

Listen to a few originals from Sean Cabatana's in-progress unreleased album too.

schedule_organisation.name: Sean Cabatana
schedule_organisation.description: Sean Cabatana is an electric guitarist, and singer-songwriter, writing new music inspired by artists who are changing the world of music today, such as Ichika Nito and Laufey. Open to collabs in the future! Reach out to him at: @skcabatana skcabatana@gmail.com

title: Falasteen (tapestry)
short_description: I crochet tapestry wall-hangings which have arabic calligraphy and/or other designs which are used as decoration or art pieces. This piece is called Falasteen, and is has aspects of the Palestinian identity, a white dove, and olive branches, as well as some calligraphy. What my pieces do is show Islam, or Islamic concepts as something artistic. This piece is both a piece of activism, and something artistic.

title: Writing Workshop
short_description: Workshop will help develop potential submissions for the summer edition of Kamena.

schedule_organisation.name: Writing Society
schedule_organisation.description:
Welcome to The Writing Society!

If you love to read, then you can learn to write, and if you love to write- then you have come to the right place.

You're already a writer! Most people use language each day without contemplating what they’ve done, Writing Society offers you a space, not only to continue to manoeuvre the language choices that you make, but to understand why you make them.

By writing fiction, poetry, scripts, and plays you can explore how to manipulate language in a meaningful way- all alongside people who share your passion!

schedule_organisation.description: Warwick Comedy Society offers the opportunity to write, perform and direct comedy -  from sketch to stand-up - putting on shows throughout the year and then taking them to the Edinburgh Fringe, Leicester Comedy Festival and elsewhere. We welcome all new members, from freshers to PhD students, regardless of previous comedic experience!

title: Art By Balqis: Spring Exclusive 2024
long_description: Hi there! I'm a self-taught watercolour, acrylic, acrylic paint pouring and oil painter for the past 6 years. Recently, I just released a watercolour Eid card collection for Eid. The designs range from Malaysian Batik motives, floral wreaths and traditional Malay delicacies. For WSAF especially, I am unveiling 4 new watercolour pieces as this year's Spring Exclusive. To know more, do head to @artbybalqis on Instagram. Be sure to drop by, I hope to see you there!

title: Being a 419er
long_description: 419 Football Club is an independent intramural football team split from the Warwick Nigerian Society. It is not just about football, but also about brotherhood and a safe community for minority voices to be heard.

title: Chicken Soup with Barley
short_description: Chicken Soup with Barley is a 1956 play by Arnold Wesker that grapples with the breakdown of an ideology and a family in parallel, synthesising the personal, political, and philosophical into an odyssey across decades that reveals the power of brotherhood even in a country that always seems in decline. Our production would modernise the text and give it a queer edge to explore the prescience of community and caring in the modern age.
